data.title: Smells great and can't beat the price
data.body: Garnier Fructis Shampoo has become a staple in my hair care routine, and for good reason. This shampoo not only cleanses effectively but also leaves my hair feeling incredibly fresh and revitalized. The fruity fragrance is delightful and lingers, providing a burst of freshness throughout the day. I have noticed a significant improvement in the overall health of my hair since using this shampoo regularly. The formula is gentle yet effective, removing impurities without stripping away natural oils, leaving my hair clean, soft, and manageable. It also tackles frizz and adds a healthy shine to my locks. The affordability of Garnier Fructis Shampoo makes it a fantastic value for the quality it delivers. I appreciate that it caters to various hair types, making it suitable for a wide range of users. Overall, this shampoo is a reliable and affordable choice for those looking to achieve clean, healthy, and great-smelling hair.

data.title: a remarkable addition to my hair care routine
data.body:
I recently had the pleasure of trying Garnier Fructis Pure Clean Purifying Shampoo, and I can confidently say it's a fantastic addition to my hair care routine. This shampoo has surpassed my expectations in numerous ways, and I'd like to share why I believe it's such a remarkable product:

Efficient Residue Removal: This shampoo is a game-changer when it comes to removing residue from my hair. After each wash, my hair feels incredibly clean, soft, and refreshed. It truly lives up to the promise of purifying the hair.

Nourishing Formula: What sets Garnier Fructis Pure Clean apart is its infusion of aloe extract, Vitamins B3 & B6. Not only does it cleanse effectively, but it also hydrates and nurtures my hair, leaving it healthy and vibrant. The best part? There's no heavy, greasy feeling â€“ just clean, revitalized strands.

Versatile and Gentle: It's gentle enough for daily use and suitable for all hair types. Whether I'm washing my hair every day or just a few times a week, I can depend on this shampoo to provide a consistent and reliable clean.

Eco-Friendly Commitment: I appreciate Garnier's commitment to Greener Beauty. The use of 100% Recycled Plastic for their bottles is a step in the right direction to reduce environmental impact. It's heartening to see a brand dedicated to sustainable practices.

Free from Harsh Chemicals: The fact that this shampoo is paraben-free and silicone-free is a significant advantage. It gives me peace of mind, knowing that I'm not subjecting my hair to harsh or unnecessary chemicals.

Cruelty-Free and Vegan: The Leaping Bunny certification and vegan status further highlight Garnier's commitment to ethical and cruelty-free practices. It's a reassuring aspect for conscientious consumers like myself.

In conclusion, Garnier Fructis Pure Clean Purifying Shampoo is a remarkable addition to my hair care routine. Its efficient residue removal, nourishing formula, and eco-friendly commitments make it a top choice. I've experienced fantastic results, and I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone in search of a reliable, eco-conscious shampoo that leaves hair clean, soft, and revitalized. Garnier's dedication to purity, sustainability, and ethical practices truly shine through in this product. Your hair will thank you for it!

Megusta

data.title: It leaves my hair a little too soft and limp
data.body:
This is not a horrible shampoo. It smells good, and the fragrance is not too strong. It lathers pretty well. Unfortunately, it leaves my hair a little to soft and a bit over-moisturized, even if I don't use a conditioner afterwards. It weighs my hair down and I'm left with no bounce and a somewhat slimy feel.

My hair is normal and there's a lot of it. My scalp can get oily on occasion. My hair does not get very dry. I rarely wash my hair every day. I don't color my hair, so it doesn't have chemical damage. All I need is a decent clean so I can condition as needed, if needed, and use a leave-in oil product to impart some shine.

I've used this shampoo a number of times, thinking maybe it was me or an odd day, but it just isn't working for me. This would probably be best used by someone with dry hair/scalp who wants to clarify gently. Even better if your hair is also frizzy. This might be perfect for you.

It just leaves my hair a little too soft and mushy, and a little too tamed.

It's well-priced and worth a try. It would really be great if it was just a tad less aggressive in its moisture.

data.title: Great product but bottle leaks
data.body:
First of all, I love this product and am a regular user and purchaser through Amazon. It would be a five star review at a brick and mortar store, but a 4 star review as purchased through Amazon. The only reason is because the bottle leaks. Even if the cap never gets dislodged, unless the bottle is shipped in a vertical position all the way through the shipping process (which is unlikely), the shampoo inside will seep out. Sometimes, the bottle will be wrapped in its own plastic bag if shipped in a box with other purchases, but often times it will not be. For this reason, the shampoo is no longer in my subscribe and save orders, which often includes food packages that I don't want to be permeated with shampoo - think baking flours, cacao powder, etc.

The workaround that works for me is to try to ensure that this product is only shipped with other mild cleansing products - such as other shampoos, soaps, liquid dishwashing detergents. If this is part of your subscribe and save delivery, do not include products you intend to consume unless the package can be safely rinsed off. If you order this with other items, select a different delivery method for just the shampoo if possible i,e, if you have Prime, perhaps you select 2-day shipping for the shampoo and free Amazon day delivery for the rest of your order.

I will continue to order the product, because I like the product and the price is reasonable compared to what you would pay elsewhere.

data.title: Like Product but Came Damaged
data.body: One of the bottles of shampoo leaked into shipping box. Liquids should be contained better as not to leak and possibly cause damage to other items or ship separately from non- liquid items. Grateful books were not damaged!

data.title: Its okay if you live in a place with decent water quality
data.body: The purpose of this shampoo is to remove residue, particularly if you have hard water but that's only up to a. certain extent. I took this with me to Thailand knowing how bad the water quality is (since I lived there before) and during my two months stay this shampoo didn't help much and hair loss was inevitable. My scalp was still itchy despite using this. I'll give it a try when I'm back in the states.

data.title: Best Economical Non-Silicone Shampoo
data.body: This shampoo leaves your hair feeling clean with no grimy residue. It is the only shampoo I can use. Compared to the more expensive options, it works just as well and Amazon is always running deals on it. I've tried over 30 shampoos, and I just keep coming back to this one since it leaves no film or artificial feeling afterwards.

data.title: Somehow the best shampoo ever?
data.body: Never did I think that the $3 shampoo from Walmart would be the greatest purchase I've ever made. I've been using the expensive, salon stuff for YEARS with no satisfaction. I threw this bottle in the cart one day when money was tight, and my hair care life was never the same again. This shampoo cleanses the hair perfectly, leaving my scalp and I feeling squeaky clean after a wash. I usually shampoo my hair every other day, but because I do modern dance that entails a lot of rolling around on the dirty dance studio floors, I sometimes wash my hair two days in a row. This shampoo allows that. It doesn't build up in the scalp and is very lightweight. I pair this with the same conditioner, usually, but other conditioners work perfectly well with this shampoo, at least in my experience. 10/10 highly recommend! And you can't beat that price.

data.title: Best cheap shampoo EVER!
data.body:
My daughter and I use Matrix and also Sebastian Drench on a regular basis, so I don't trust too many cheap shampoos. Except this one!
It'll get your hair clean, won't dry it out. It's clear. It smells good not strong or like * man* shampoo. A little bit goes a long way.
This is good to use a few times every 10 days in-between your higher-end salon shampoo, if you're one of those ppl like us who wash your hair every other day.
This might be good for ppl with oily hair who wash more often. We used a clarifying one, by Kendra. Was clear and smelled like grapefruit. I like this one a little better.
The price can't be beat and it is awesome.
